No, they are not overrated. Currently, the chipset solution W1 that Apple has engineered is simply superior to the other available solutions from Qualcomm, Realtek and Airoha. These are the chipsets that allow pairing, keep the two independent ear pieces paired and other functions such as battery level, etc. Apple does not sell these chips and so all other makes and models use one of these other solutions. None of these are inexpensive and so this means that compromises must be made such as quality of the driver (sound quality), battery size, output level, etc. and so you see that some higher quality units are as much or even more money than the Apple units. While some of the other brands and solutions may sound better to you, currently in terms of connection and ease of use, none of them match the Apple. This may change as new chip solutions emerge, but this is also seen in the massive share Apple has in the market. In these cases, the numbers tell the tale. That does not mean you may not be happy with lower priced solutions, nor does it explain the vitriol some use in terms about Apple. The choice is always for the consumer.
